data.title: GReat Food Again!
data.text: Had dinner with some friends this past weekend and the food nd service was excellent. Food was fresh and served hot! Portions were huge, took some home with me. Thanks again to the great staff for a wonderful experience.

data.title: Fabulous!
data.text: The food is fabulous.  The portions are huge.  The tomato pesto pasta was delicious.  The place is tiny, but they also have outdoor seating.   You can't go wrong here.

data.title: Absolutely  amazing!
data.text:
Famous Bistro dining experience  was definitely fabulous.  Ate with group of friends.  We had a variety of appetizers, entrees, and desserts.  Everything was "lick your plate delicious" and top quality, as well as locally sourced when possible.  I had Chicken Marsala and it was wonderful.  Our server, Christina, could not have been  more attentive, knowledgeable,  and personable. Beautiful presentations!  Portions are more than generous.  Great atmosphere.  Marvelous cuisine.  Manager/chef  checked on us to ensure everything was satisfactory.
Very much worth the trip for a memorable dinner at a non-chain restaurant.

data.title: Average Fare
data.text: My moussaka like entree was served in a small ramekin - think French onion soup. But too dry. Flavors muddled. Spanikopita appetizer decent. Wine night brings cost of bottles down to OK, although featured white was a little foxy. I did like the salad.

data.title: Bistro extraordinary
data.text: This is the place to get a special soup and sandwich. Not ordinary food; extra special food. Great service and atmosphere.

data.title: Famous Bistro never disappoints
data.text: Always amazing menu selections. If you are tired of the same ol thing for lunch, try Famous Bistro. Soups, salads, sandwiches... my favorite is the spanakopita!😋

data.title: Wonderful!
data.text: Come early or make a reservations!  Wonderful food!! The staff was amazing, helpful, and friendly.  Can't wait to have the opportunity to return!

data.title: Great food and staff
data.text: Try the cheese steaks, they're multiple different ones and they're all great. Also the eggplant moussaka is really good. The array of menu selections at this place is really incredible. Although the the prices go up substantially at night for dinner. It's small charming atmosphere is worth the extra couple bucks to support a local non chain restaurant.

data.title: It is Not all Greek to Me
data.text: The Bistro is a great, consistent presence in downtown Owensboro. Originally more heavy on Greek influences, it seems to have notched that back. The menu for lunch is heavy on sandwiches (including grinders and gyros) and pizza, but offers some salads, excellent soups and a few Greek dishes. There is a good amount on the menu, but they are starting to feel very similar so the choices feel more limited. It is unfortunately light on Greek offerings.  It would be wonderful if they continued to distinguish themselves by adding even more Greek offerings and twists on standard sandwiches during lunch hour. There are a lot of sandwich places, so having something unique is a good thing. Four of us were there for lunch recently and each ordered different items. Those that ordered grinders said they came out hot and flavorful, but were a little shy on the contents leaving a lot of bread in each bite. The bread was good, but a little more content would have sent the grinders over the top. The full sandwiches are big, and with all that bread require a big appetite. A 1/2 may be perfect for those less hungry.  We had phenomenal Hungarian mushroom soup. It was hearty but still seemed light, and the flavors were rich and deep. I could get a bowl rather than a cup and still want more, but the cup was just right.  We also had a chicken soup chock full of chicken and pasta. I had a small Greek salad with add on shrimp. It was tiny rather than small, so take note if you are hungry. The shrimp add on was 3 shrimp. The salad was crisp, the dressimg was nice and tart, and the feta was in a block and had a terrific texture that allowed you to chunk it up in sizes to your liking. Good salad. The shrimp was cooked fine, but were small and really added nothing to the salad. The lunch crowd is heavy, and even with outside seating the Bistro can fill up, so reservations for 11:30-1 are a good idea. The Bistro's evening menu is also good, and the atmosphere is cozy. But having even more Greek offerings would continue to allow it to distinguish itself at dinner, too.  This place is consistently good and should stay on everyone's radar. Visitors really enjoy having independent restaurant options when they come, and definitely enjoy having those that offer more global flavors.

data.title: Unbelievably Awesome Dinner
data.text: Enjoyed the ribeye special. The cut of meat from Black Hawk along with the amazing job the chef did in preparing produced a steak that just melted in your mouth. All the food coming out of the kitchen looked delicious. The chef gave me a taste of the 14 hour marinated pork chop in a peppercorn gravy. It was the most tender piece of pork ever and favors were amazing. The waitstaff complimented the fine food with great service (Ashley). This restaurant should be #1 in Owensboro. I definitely will be back.

data.title: Fun place
data.text: I wish I could give this place a 4.5. The service was excellent. The food quality was well above average so why not a 5? Some of the food items were not to my personal liking. I will gladly return to sample other parts of the menu.

data.title: Always awesome!
data.text: Our favorite place to eat in Owensboro. We had the Spanakopita appetizer with Tzatziki sauce, Greek salad (my husband had the Caesar salad), for dinner, I had the chicken Marsala (pictured), my husband had the braised pork chop with garlic mashed potatoes and broccolini. For dessert, Baklava of course!  And a brownie with cinnamon gelato for my husband.  (Both pictured). I would definitely recommend them all!  With a bottle of Te'amo Chianti, of course!

data.title: A delightful first visit
data.text: I went on a Monday at around 3:00 and for a while was the only customer but the waiter told me that later it would be busier as Monday evenings are usually one of their busiest nights.  Their beer selection is extensive.   I ordered the Greek Pizza and it was good, the tzatziki  sauce that came with it was wonderful.  For dessert I selected tiramisu and it was wonderful.  To make the lunch very wonderful it would have been great to have an espresso but alas that was not an option.  The waiter was great.

data.title: Evening out with family
data.text: The food is delicious Greek cuisine that you can't get just anywhere. Wonderful service in a cozy, eclectic environment. Love it!

data.title: Lunch
data.text:
Local Gem💎

We have always loved this place!!! Best homemade chicken soup and specials . Nice location downtown, quaint personal service . Shout out to Christine for taking care of us!!!!

data.title: Fabulous Experience!
data.text:
We were passing through Owensboro and looking for a local, non-corporate-chain lunch stop in the downtown area.  I can't imagine making a better choice!  Not only was the food outstanding but also was the service.  I loved that our server offered a sample of the mushroom soup (made with paprika and dill) because we both ordered it.  Also, they make the perfect grilled cheese sandwich the traditional way! 

If ever in Owensboro again, this will definitely be a repeat stop for us.

data.title: Seriously Amazing
data.text: The food is some of the best I've ever had - everything is homemade family recipes the chef and soux chef are amazingly talented plus everything is beautiful the portions are big and beautiful - and everything tastes phenomenal - so pleased I got the chance to eat here! On top of all that the staff are amazing - I think I've said amazing 10 times now :) please do yourself a favor and eat here!

data.title: Early dinner
data.text: Arrived around 6 they found a table for us but all tables were taken by the time we left. The staff was wonderful, very knowledgeable. Food was very good,I had a salad hubby had the special of the day,lake trout well prepared.the best part was the vanilla bourbon creme brûlée,delicious.Nice selection of food.

owner_response.author: Jared B, General Manager at Famous Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much! We really appreciate you coming to dine with us!!
Chef Jared
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: We had never been to this little place but I promise u we will be back the food was spectacular, service beyond stellar, and great location!

data.title: Wonderful food and staff!
data.text: Each and every time we dine at Famous Bistro it's another wonderful experience. Located in downtown Owensboro, this gem never ceases to amaze my taste buds with their fine homemade food. If you're looking for something unique and tasty - pay a visit to this wonderful place.

owner_response.author: Jared B, General Manager at Famous Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
wow Thank you so much!!
chef jared
owner_response.title: Owner Response
